roleset.name: alert, warn

example.name: just transitive
example.text: When the hacker moved, Mr. Stoll moved too, *trace* calling up other systems managers to alert them but keeping his own system open to avoid arousing suspicion.

example.name: alert to
example.text: She gives the Artist a sense of purpose, but also alerts him to the serious inadequacy of his vagrant life.
example.arg: to the serious inadequacy of his vagrant life.

example.name: alert about
example.text: The solicitation material indicates that donations will go toward a campaign alerting and informing the public about some health or other issue.
example.arg: about some health or other issue.

example.name: alert a wh-clause
example.text: After discovering that the hacker had taken over the dormant account of a legitimate user named Joe Sventek, he rigged up an alarm system, including a portable beeper, *trace* to alert him when Sventek came on the line.
example.arg: when Sventek came on the line.

example.name: alert an SBAR
example.text: That disclosure came, a Delmed spokeswoman said, after the American Stock Exchange alerted the company that trading wouldn't resume in its stock until additional information about developments was provided.
example.arg: that trading wouldn't resume in its stock until additional information about developments was provided.

example.name: arg 1
example.text: The terror alert for subway commuters

roleset.note: ALERT-V NOTES: Member of Vncls advise-37.9. (from alert.01-v)
ALERT-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. Comparison to 'alert.01'. Vn class advise-37.9. No Fn class. Framed by Katie. (from alert.01-n)

roleset.name: be alive; awake and watchful

example.name: aware of surroundings
example.text: Patient is alert and oriented times three

roleset.note: ALERT-J NOTES: Based on Sharp data. No comparison. Framed by Katie. (from alert.01-j)
